channel.title: Comments on: Ecofont, Will this save the planet?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jack
item.dc:creator: Jack
item.content:encoded:
I downloaded software from the Ecofont website and compared the print out with printing in grayscale. The ecofont print (i printed in the arial font) looked sharper compared to the grayscale output. When you put it under the magnifyer i noticed the holes in the ecofont print out varies in diameter and are exactly in the middle of the letter. In grayscale there were many little holes at a fixed distance. As a result the outline of the letter is not intact. I guess that makes the difference.

BTW I was supprised to see it works with normal fonts, I did not had to install the ecofont with holes.

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: Yes, unless it is something I need to compare pages side by side for one reason or another.
item.content:encoded: Yes, unless it is something I need to compare pages side by side for one reason or another.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Alex, I think that it boils down to this
use less ink–>less cartridges needed–>less times trucks have to deliver cartridges to stores–>less cartridges have to be manufactured

So you save in the oil that is used to ship the cartridges and also oil used to create the cartridges since they are made of plastic…but HP won’t be too happy probably

But yeah, don’t print and you even save more…

Does any of you print doublesided?

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: Good point E. I wasn't aware that ink was the thing killing our planet - if you want to save it not printing it out at all seems a better choice? Or are the cartridges the problem?
item.content:encoded: Good point E. I wasn’t aware that ink was the thing killing our planet – if you want to save it not printing it out at all seems a better choice? Or are the cartridges the problem?

item.title: By: Erik
item.dc:creator: Erik
item.description: Just print in gray and it will use less ink and be more readable. Instead of a few big holes that make it hard to read, it will have hundreds of tiny, evenly-spaced holes in it that simply make it look gray.
item.content:encoded: Just print in gray and it will use less ink and be more readable. Instead of a few big holes that make it hard to read, it will have hundreds of tiny, evenly-spaced holes in it that simply make it look gray.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
>>You don’t have a printer at home? How does your wife print coupons?

she calls me at work and tells them to print them ðŸ™‚

I really don’t use coupons that much except what we get in the mail

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.content:encoded:
You don’t have a printer at home? How does your wife print coupons?

Seriously, you’ll likely need one as your children will need to write papers and print science projects, etc.

As to the font itself: it looks like it would likely save ink. On the downside, it’s not very readable. It’s a noble effort, but seems almost silly in its execution.
